overview:
Kendall Coffey, founding partner of Coffey Burlington in Miami, FL and former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida.

Kendall Coffey graduated at the University of Florida School of Law, and has served in several roles, which include being a founding member of Coffey, Aragon, Martin & Burlington and acting as former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida. He has taken part in several high-end cases.

With many outstanding achievements in his career Kendall Coffey, is now a household name in the entire United States. The public has several times appreciated and enjoyed Kendall Coffey’s frequent appearances on CNN and other news channels where he shared his valuable insights on several matters of the law.

Kendall Coffey is currently a partner at Coffey Burlington in Miami, concentrating on complex litigation at trial and appellate levels in both federal and state courts.

Kendall Coffey is also a well known author. “Foreclosures in Florida” and “Spinning the Law” are two famous books that were authored by Kendall Coffey. In Spinning the Law, Trying Cases in the Court of Public Opinion, Kendall Coffey has given his own views on high profile cases of United states and also provides a stellar look at why lawyers concentrate on not only what’s going on in the courtroom but also what’s being fed to the court of public opinion.

video_embeds.description: Kendall Coffey on the George Zimmerman case, did Sanford police want to arrest Zimmerman?
Kendall Coffey at the Miami Book Fair
